data.title: Remember faction for the mod?
data.body:
Would be nice, but simple addition.

So if i play almost always with Allies, i dont have to select it every time i play.

data.title: Very long loading time in OSX
data.body:
OpenRA is taking way too long to load on OSX. I was thinking that something was blocking the startup process but I've run 

```
sudo dtruss -f -t open mono --debug OpenRA.Game.exe
```

and he is taking a very hard time loading all the fonts on my system. I also have Photoshop on my system, which installs a bunch of additional fonts. This should have a small GUI saying "Loading fonts" or running on another thread.

data.title: TD, Helicopters Can't Use Attack Move, and Can't Use Queued Commands.
data.body:
Orca, Apache, and Chinook can't use attack move, and can't queue commands.

This is true in TD. I'm not sure about RA.

data.title: Implement isometric selection box and health bars for structures in isometric mods
data.body:
Tiberian Sun currently uses the same square selection box for structures that is common to all previous mods. This should be updated to the isometric angled selection area and health bar used in TS and RA2.

![a2cc7cd98d1001e92c94479cb80e7bec55e797fc_188 1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3650108/2320833/097e5cf2-a396-11e3-97e4-ffc3963851ed.jpg)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431750-implement-isometric-selection-box-and-health-bars-for-structures-in-isometric-mods?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Chinook rotors don't counter-rotate
data.body: Affects both RA and C&C.

data.title: Reverse aircraft landing direction or windsock direction
data.body:
Currently all aircraft land with a tailwind. Landing with a tailwind is horrible and we shouldn't do it.

Should reverse one.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431599-reverse-aircraft-landing-direction-or-windsock-direction?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Disguised spy's health bars are red with Team Health Colors enabled
data.body: Should show as green to that enemies' team rather than red when disguised

data.title: TD, Deploy Hotkey "F" Sends Orca To The Closest Helipad, but DOESN'T Repair.
data.body:
First, it is suprising the F hotkey actually does something for the Orca. Orcas don't have a deploy command via mouse click.

When sent to land via the F button, the Orcas don't repair after they land. You have to land the Orca again using the mouse clock command.

Being able to send Orcas home with the F button is good. Not repairing is bad. The only reason you ever want to land an Orca in TD is for repairs!

I am going to assume the Nod Apache has the same problem. I will test that a bit later.

data.title: TD, Veteran Infantry Are Immune To Tiberium Poisoning
data.body:
They get this immunity at the very first bar of chevron.

IMO, They shouldn't get this at any level.

data.title: TD, Attack Move Command Does Nothing For Air Units.
data.body:
The Attack Move Command can be issued to the Apache, Orca, and Chinook, but these units don't respond to it.

On a side note, non-combat ground units, such as the MCV, Harvester, and Engineer will respond to Attack Move Commands as if they were Move commands (which is good).

data.title: TD, Attack Move Command Can't Be Queued After Other Commands
data.body:
Attack Move Command CAN'T be queued after other commands.

On a side note, other commands CAN be queued after an Attack Move Command.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431562-td-attack-move-command-can-t-be-queued-after-other-commands?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TD, Chinook Transport Deploy Command Can't Be Issued In Flight, Let Alone Queued
data.body:
If I order a Chinook Transport to move from A to B, the deploy command is disabled.

A flying chinook simply can't be ordered to deploy, but a moving APC can be. 

The chinook should be made to be the same as the APC in regards to how it is controlled.

data.title: Exit transport command can't be queued.
data.body:
If I order an APC to move from A to B, then hold down SHIFT, then click on the APC, the move command will be canceled, and the APC will deploy its infantry at its current location.

If I order an APC to move from A to B, then hold down SHIFT, then push F, the APC will move to location B and then do nothing.

This was tested in the TD mod.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431564-exit-transport-command-can-t-be-queued?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TD, MCV Deploy Command Can't Be Queued With Hotkey
data.body:
If I order an MCV to move from A to B, then hold down shift, then click on the MCV, the MCV will deploy after reaching location B.

If I order an MCV to move from A to B, then hold down shift, then push F, the MCV will not deploy when it gets to B.

This was tested in the TD mod.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431565-td-mcv-deploy-command-can-t-be-queued-with-hotkey?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Chat window allows switching to team speak for dead players with no effect
data.body:
After a player is defeated and is still in the game as a spectator, the chat window still allows switching to team speak mode but what is typed is seen by everyone. This is misleading, there shouldn't be any team speak while dead.

This might be related to dead players being able to pause-spam the game.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1431162-chat-window-allows-switching-to-team-speak-for-dead-players-with-no-effect?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove reloading from air units
data.body: Air units need to reload ammunition pretty quickly and it is really annoying to have to deal with their reloading especially if there aren't enough airfields/helipads. And this is an arbitrary feature, no other unit requires ammo reload so why should air units do? If this would make air units too powerful, the anti air capabilities of other units could be improved to keep the balance. This change would make the gameplay more fluid and fun.

data.title: Make game settings menu accessable while in game lobby
data.body: Right now there is no way of changing game settings without leaving the game lobby. This could be done using tabs for example.

data.title: Option to block players with bad latency in game lobby
data.body:
Instead of asking people with bad ping to leave or having to kick them individually, there could be an option to set a maximum value for latency as a requirement for joining the game. Since one player with bad ping causes the whole game to lag, it is quite important that everyone has good connection.

This feature would also require a latency filter for game listing so that only games that allow the player to join are listed.

data.title: Fixed map.yaml sequences being ignored
data.body: As described in #4765. Test case was `mono --debug OpenRA.Lint.exe ra mods/ra/maps/bomber-john`.

data.title: "Show range" button.
data.body:
Hold down a button to see a range circle for the current selected unit(s).

Mite-b-cool?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1430975-show-range-button?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Aircraft defence balance changes
data.body: I believe these changes make anti-air defenses less insta-win on placement and not so "one defense solves everything" anymore. Aircraft are given a chance to escape when they're placed now (SAM Sites used to 1-shot MiGs or level clumped aircraft quite quickly, so if you accidentally got in range you'd be hurting). If you still try to take defenses head on with aircraft, the aircraft can lose, which leads me to think the current defense damage was already too much.

data.title: Lint: show soft warnings only in verbose mode
data.body:
Such warnings like
`OpenRA.Lint(1,1): Warning: Sprite image miner from actor minvv has no sequence definition.` seems do not affect anything especially if it's Lua map.
Something should be done about this. Ideally Lint without "-v" have to return nothing if map is playable and not broken and such soft warnings should be shown only if "-v" specified.

data.title: all mods load maps twice on start up
data.body:
Everything points to it.
To see, just add a duplicate map and start OpenRA client.
You will get "Failed to load map..... element with the same key already exists in dictionary" and then after a couple of seconds you will get it again.

data.title: Added a snow variation of TENT by Kilkakon
data.body:
Converted to RA palette by Kilkakon himself. 

http://kilkakon.com/projects.php?category=0&base=Command+and+Conquer

data.title: Z offset is not applied
data.body: This is currently holding of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4673 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4393.

data.title: Port the desert shellmap to Lua
data.body:
Also fixes the weapons of ants/zombies/dinos and removes the temperate shellmap.
Closes #4542

data.title: Download access to all music files for RA & TD in settings menu.
data.body:
Seems like this would involve a hosting site for the RA & TD .mix files. I've learned the files are subsequently about 110mb and 37mb.

But imagine the convenience for new and less tech savvy players to be able to just click a download button and have all the goodies delivered straight into the playlist. I'm sure this could be a very valuable feature.

data.title: System.InvalidOperationException while unloading transport ships
data.body:
I was unloading 3 full transports side-by-side and got this crash.

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Sequence contains no matching element
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[SubCell] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 predicate, Fallback fallback) [0x00050] in /private/tmp/source/bockbuild-mono-3.2.6/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-3.2.6/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:818 
  at System.Linq.Enumerable.First[SubCell] (IEnumerable`1 source, System.Func`2 predicate) [0x00007] in /private/tmp/source/bockbuild-mono-3.2.6/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-3.2.6/mcs/class/System.Core/System.Linq/Enumerable.cs:843 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Move.Mobile.GetDesiredSubcell (CPos a, OpenRA.Actor ignoreActor) [0x00033] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.RA//Move/Mobile.cs:387 
  at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Activities.UnloadCargo+<Tick>c__AnonStorey6E.<>m__1E (OpenRA.World w) [0x0002f] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.RA//Activities/UnloadCargo.cs:77 
  at OpenRA.World.Tick () [0x0017e] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//World.cs:231 
  at OpenRA.Game.TickInner (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00135] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:198 
  at OpenRA.Game.Tick (OpenRA.Network.OrderManager orderManager) [0x00034] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:124 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x0007b] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Game.cs:445 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00011] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:114 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0005a] in /Users/thill/Desktop/Taryn/Projects/OpenRA/OpenRA.Game//Support/Program.cs:38 
```

Here is [the replay](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B4Mag-oGBQNCeGM0eVJVN1hxc1k/edit?usp=sharing). There are quite a few things that happen in this game that are unrelated.
